Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

Node.gloss: to comfort|to console|to reassure|to express sympathy|to bring relief
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities seek to make (other) humans feel relief after a time of grief, anxiety, or fear

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= process by which a certain activity come to an end
= state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: double; hence: = state in which an event or state is double or more than double in intensity than what is expected
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to make straight|to make smooth|to make level|to make even
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects to be without curve or bend and/or have an even or regular surface
= a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations

Node.gloss: to become high|to be lifted up
Node.definition: = process by which an object increases in height
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= an area of fairly level, high ground; ≈ sometimes associated with a lack of obstacles, both literally and figuratively
= a more or less flat and relatively low region, usually between uplands, hills or mountains, and following the course of a stream

Node.gloss: to be laid bare|to become visible
Node.definition: = process by which an object becomes visible because other objects that used to cover them are removed
= a manifestation of God, sometimes visible, either in a cloud, or looking like fire, capable of speech
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another
= living creature, including both humans and animals; ◄ conceived as an object that mainly consists of flesh; ≈ regarded as weak and passing
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived

= state in which humans or deities are committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions; these obligations include responsibilities towards kinspeople, spouses, friends, covenant partners, and people to whom one is indebted as a result of favors received
= flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

= a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God
= flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

= a natural movement of air, blowing in a particular direction, ranging in intensity from a light breeze to a heavy blast ; ≈ often regarded as the breath of God, but also associated with things that are without substance and cannot be grasped
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which air moves across a surface or against an object
= marker used to affirm the truth of the following statement
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= type of grass; ◄ plants; ► serves as food for animals; ≈ regarded as weak, vulnerable, and short lived

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God
= flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= state in which a person or object is of great or more than average height; ≈ associated with status

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
= action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
literally: to lift up (one's) voice; hence: = action by which humans speak more loudly than usual
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= action by which humans pass on information to someone else, having been commissioned to do so by a deity or another person
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
literally: to lift up (one's) voice; hence: = action by which humans speak more loudly than usual

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= a fixed regular payment for work, either with money or in kind; ≈ by extension: all that happens in return for one's actions
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
= each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈ directly associated with strength and power
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose
= young sheep, perhaps unweaned; ≈ fully dependent on its mother for nourishment and on the shepherd for protection

= front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

= causative action by which humans or deities help (other) humans or animals to journey from one place to the other by accompanying them and providing them with resources and protection whenever necessary

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans or deities ascertain the size or quantity of something by comparing it with a standard unit or with an object of known size
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= the distance between top of the thumb and the little finger of an outstretched hand, which is the equivalent of half a cubit (אַמָּה)
= state in which a container is able to accomodate something within its available space
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)

= contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans come together to exercise their minds as a group to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

Node.gloss: to instruct|to give instruction|to teach|to give understanding|to explain
Node.definition: = pattern of actions by which someone helps others to gain knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= practices that conform to the laws of God
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals intentionally or unintentionally to acquire knowledge, skill, or behavior; usually refers to learning to the point of doing
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to make known|to show|to inform|to tell|to teach
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to acquire information about (other) humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= a small quantity of a liquid
= open container ► used to carry water

= contraption consisting of rod held by a cord in the middle and with pans attached to both ends; ► used for weighing objects; sometimes used figuratively in expressions describing people's status or integrity or the seriousness of a situation in terms of weight
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event
= area located near the sea and/or the people living there; ≈ associated with commerce, remoteness, paganism, but also called on to acknowledge YHWH
= state in which an object has opposite surface or sides relatively close together
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose
= action by which someone causes something else to be harmed or destroyed by fire
possibly shortened form of נֶפֶשׁ חַיָּה living creature: = animal; ◄ generic, sometimes referring to all animals, sometimes limited to wild land animals only

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= state in which an object is non existent, implying that it has been destroyed, or that it exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
= state of being non existent, implying that an existing object has been destroyed, or that an object exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant
= something that has no value and hence does not profit anyone
= to hold the opinion that a particular object, person, or event is to be identified with, considered similar to, or to be equated with another object, person, or event

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans measure the similarity or dissimilarity between two entities
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= state in which objects are, or are perceived as having something in common with other objects
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship

literally: to pour out; hence: = causative action by which humans pour molten metal into a mold ► to create a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing to be used as an object of non sanctioned worship
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal
= someone whose profession it is to work with precious metals, such as gold and silver
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity
literally: to hammer out; hence: = causative action by which a craftsman covers an object with a layer of hammered out metal
= a series of metal links or rings fitted into one another and used to joining different objects together; also used for decoration purposes
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= causative action by which a goldsmith creates an artifact from a precious metal by smelting it in the fire
= a single piece of wood taken from a tree, cut and finished, and used for building and construction
= action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another
= causative action by which humans or deities cause an object to be firmly located in a certain place
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= state in which an object is not firmly fixed to the surface on which it stands so that it can move or slip; to waver
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: head; hence: = the point in time at which an event starts happening
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it; sometimes used in a somewhat figurative sense to denote the foundations of heaven and earth

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne

= dome shaped structure; used exclusively to denote the firmament, which separates the waters above the earth from the earth itself; ≈ God is said to have his dwelling place above this structure; it is also regarded as the boundary between light and darkness

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

= type of migratory locust; consumes all vegetation; ◄ swarming creature with wings; ► clean animal which may be eaten; ≈ regarded as a small but destructive insect; its way of walking resembles that of an old man
literally: to stretch out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities causes an area to be covered with something with the shape and the flexibility of a large piece of cloth
= a screen spread over or above a surface
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= to spread out a piece of cloth or a comparable object in such a way that it covers an as large as possible area
= construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
used in poetry only; = ruler of a nation or people
= state in which an object is non existent, implying that it has been destroyed, or that it exists in people's imagination only; ≈ regarded therefore as totally insignificant

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= something that has no value and hence does not profit anyone
= causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= particle marking a proposition as not true

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= particle marking a proposition as not true

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= particle marking a proposition as not true

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= the main body of a tree, which is either the part that remains in the earth after the stem or trunk is cut off, or a branch that is planted with the intention that it develops new roots; ≈ symbol of something apparently dead that has the potential for renewed life

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing danger and destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= action by which humans measure the similarity or dissimilarity between two entities

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well
to lift up (one's eye, face); hence: = action by which humans direct their face or eyes away from the ground so that they can see what is in the distance or in the sky

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= the quantity of a number of objects or the frequency of a number of events

Node.gloss: host of heaven|sun, moon, and stars
Node.definition: = collective of all celestial bodies that give light; ◄ created by God; ► often worshiped by people, contrary to God's law; ≈ in Daniel 8 possibly used as a metaphor for the people of God
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity
literally: to cry out; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities let (other) humans know that they are to come, either by approaching them directly or sending a message
= state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children
= state in which humans and deities have physical, political, and/or military strength
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which certain information is not generally known, ◄ as if it were physically hidden
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= causative action by which a deity brings to existence something that did not exist before

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= action by which someone makes an effort to obtain information about events
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= state in which humans are weak as a result of an extended period of activity
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state of being physically strong and healthy which usually includes the ability of producing children
= state in which humans have physical, political, or military strength
= process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= a young, fully grown, unmarried male ► associated with joy and strength
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure
= process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to replace (one's) strength; hence: = action by which humans receive new strength
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to go up|to climb up|to mount
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals or objects go to a place that is situated at a higher elevation, by foot, carried by hand, or with the help of a vehicle
literally: to mount up with wings; hence: = to have considerable physical strength

exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

Node.gloss: to grow weary|to wear oneself out|to labor|to toil
Node.definition: = action by which humans are engaged in laborious activity which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= process by which humans become weak as a result of an extended period of activity
